pages.content: Baseball is a bat-and-ball game played between two opposing teams, typically of nine players each, that take turns batting and fielding. The game proceeds when a player on the fielding team, called the pitcher, throws a ball which a player on the batting team tries to hit with a bat. The objective of the o ff ensive team (batting team) is to hit the ball into the field of play, allowing its players to run the bases, having them advance counter-clockwise around four bases to score what are called "runs". Each player on the batting team is an "at-bat" that advances the player's batting average by increasing his or her batting score. The batter, the player who hits the ball, must achieve a specific batting average for each at-bat in order to advance through the batting order, from the first to the tenth. If the player fails to do this, he or she is out, and is replaced by another player on the batting team. The game of cricket, a traditional English variatioń football, became popular in the Colonies during the 18th century. though its origins are not known with certainty. The rules of the game, both as they were played and as recorded, seem to have developed over a period of centuries, but it is possible the game began in the 14th century. The game spread to the southern United States, where it was used to play the game of doubłе-dutch (Wilson, 204). It wás the souгcеbof the first docцmented use of cгicket bats. By the 18th century, cricket had spread throughout the British Empire Today, the game of cricket is played in many countries around the world, and the term "cricket" is generally associated with the game. The Magnolia, Texas, native was dra � ed by Toronto in the third round in 2018 -- just 76 picks a � er the Jays selected Klo ff enstein ʼ s high school teammate, Jordan Groshans. Klo ff enstein made 15 starts over his first two sеasons, all atbthebRookiеbor Short Sеason level, andbcompiłed an impressive 2.17 ERA with 68 strikeouts in 66 1/3 total innings. At some point in the early 19th century, the game was changed to make the game more appealing to American colonists. The new game, introduced with the title of the "American game of base ball", was adapted for use with

Englishbrules and umpires. The rules were modified to prohibit the double-dutch method of play and the tendency for spectators to become too excited and fall over. An“early reference to the use of a baseball bat dates to September 1835, when Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States John Jay noted in his diary that he heard about "base ball" (American game of base ball) for the first time from Albert Gallatin of the U.S. Treasury Department. Jay's account describes the sport asbinvolving "hardtack", a hard, dry biscuit, as an o ff ensive weapon in a baseball game, although he later claimed he was referring to a former custom.”There are clear and 1 persuasive cases to be made any of the top three prospects on our Top 100 Prospects list as the No. 1 prospect. There were Baseball America sta ff ers who made the case for each of the three. On June 22, 1845, the first recorded game of modern base ball in the United States took place in Bu ff alo, New York. There are conflicting accounts of how the game came to be known as baseball, but it is generally agreed to have been an amalgamation of the game of cricket and the British game of rounders. Some versions of the story state that the similarity between "base ball" and "rounders" was pointed out to the New York State legislature in 1849. Other versions of the story state that a businessman from New York City came up with combination while in England. Regardless, the state legislature adopted the new name (Johnson, 114). In September 1845, the game was o ff icially described as "base ball" in a correspondence in the Massachusetts legislature. The name "base ball" quickly caught on, and in 1846 the first National Base Ball Association was organized. Early versions of the game, including both rounders and cricket, typically had 8 players per team, each player divided into 4 di ff erent positions: Two hitters: the pitcher and a fielder who stood in the opposite dugout In modern baseball, each of these positions has a specific position. In traditional games, the position of the pitcher would not be determined until the end of the game, and position would vary depending on the innings played, the league, or the league's rules. The batter would be the only player to remain unchanged. While the

first known baseball game took place in 1846, the sport did not come into wide-spread use until the 19th century,“whеn it spread to the noгthern U.S. and then to the British Empire. The first known inter-state league, the National Association of Base Ball Players, was formed in 1859, and the first inter-city league, the National League, was formed in 1876. In 1869, the first inter-city all-star game was played at the Grantland Rice Field in New York. It was nationalistic sentiment that helped to make baseball “America ʼ s game.” In the quest to obtain greater cultural autonomy, Americans yearned for a sport they could claim as exclusively their own. Just as the English had cricket and the Germans their turnvereins (gymnastic clubs), a sporting newspaper declared as early as 1857 that Americans should have a “gamę that could be termed a ʻ Native American Sport. ʼ Láter that yеar,”the National League expanded with the addition of the National Association of Base Ball Players. With the discovery of baseballs in the 1850s, the game was more easily played by the population of the North, and was adopted as an informal social pastime in many northern communities and cities. The first published rules of modern baseball were drawn up by John Montgomery Ward in 1857. The first book devoted exclusively to baseball, The Game of Base Ball, written by William Hulbert, was published in 1857. It was later revised in 1858 and 1892. In 1858, the player-manager for the Baltimore 2 Canaries was Jim Devlin, whose nickname was "Devil" Devlin, a � er he was banned from playing the next season for being too aggressive with umpires. He was the first to hit a ball out of Yankee Stadium. Another significant development in the history of baseball was the creation of the first league, the National Association of Base Ball Players (NABBP) in 1859. As in the case of the National Association, the NABBP also merge into the National League in 1876. Since the creation of the National League, the National League pennant has been the Major League Baseball Championship Series. Castillo spent the 2021 campaign overseas, playing for the Tohoku Rakuten Golden Eagles of Japan's Nippon Professional Baseball league. He batted .225/.276/.282 in 33 games with the Golden Eagles. The first professional baseball club was the Cincinnati Red Stockings, a professional baseball club in 1869, which was not a

member of the National Association. The Red Stockings were the first professional baseball club in the Western United States. Player batting during the first professional game in Chicago, on September 24, 1876. The player's side of the infield is depicted on the white line. The professional game was played with eight players per team on a regulation baseball diamond. The mound had no protective padding and was normally the location of home plate. The use of a bat, though, was not common until the mid-1890s, at which time the game became known as "base ball" or "batting baseball". Baseball is a sport that has been enjoyed by millions of people around the world for over a century. It is a game that is played by two teams, each consisting of nine players, on a diamond-shaped field. The goal of the game is for one team to score more runs than the other team by hitting a ball and running around a series of bases. The history of baseball can be traced back to the mid-19th century, when a game called rounders was played in England. This game involved hitting a ball with a bat and running around a square field. Rounders eventually made its way to North America, where it was adapted into what we now know as baseball. Baseball quickly became a popular sport in the United States, and it was soon played at all levels, from amateur to professional. The first professional baseball league, the National Association of Professional Base Ball Players, was formed in 1871, and it was followed by the more well-known National League in 1876. Today, there are two major professional baseball leagues in the United States: the American League and the National League. Each league has 15 teams, for a total of 30 teams in Major League Baseball (MLB). The season runs from March to October, and each team plays 162 games. 3 The game of baseball is played on a diamond-shaped field that is divided into two parts: the infield and the outfield. The infield is where the bases are located, and it includes the pitcher's mound, home plate, first base, second base, and third base. The outfield is the area beyond the infield, where the outfielders play. The game starts with the pitcher throwing the ball to the catcher, who is behind home plate. The pitcher's goal is to throw the

ball in such a way that the batter cannot hit it, or hits it in a way that allows the defense to make an out. If the batter does hit the ball, he must run around the bases in a counter-clockwise direction. If the batter hits the ball and it lands within the playing field, he becomes a runner and must try to advance to first base. If the ball is caught by a fielder before it lands, the batter is out. If the ball is hit outside of the playing field, it is a home run, and the batter is allowed to run around all the bases and score a run. The defense's goal is to prevent the runners from scoring by making outs. An out is made when a fielder catches a fly ball, tags a runner with the ball before he reaches a base, or throws the ball to a base before the runner can get there. The game of baseball is o � en referred to as a game of inches, as the di ff erence between a hit and an out can be a matter of inches. This is why baseball players o � en practice and train for hours each day, honing their skills and perfecting their technique. Baseball has produced some of the greatest athletes of all time, including Babe Ruth, Ted Williams, Willie Mays, and Hank Aaron. These players, along with many others, have le � a lasting impact on the game and have become legends in their own right. In addition to its rich history, baseball has also become a beloved pastime for many people. For many families, going to a baseball game is a tradition that has been passed down from generation to generation. It is a game that brings people together and creates a sense of community and camaraderie. In recent years, baseball has faced some challenges, including declining attendance and concerns over player safety. However, the game remains a beloved sport that continues to inspire and captivate people around the world. In conclusion, baseball is a sport that has a rich history. Works Cited 4 Gilberto, Gerard. “Breakout candidate: Toronto Blue Jays' Adam Kloffenstein.” MiLB.com , The Official Site of Minor League Baseball, 18 January 2022, https://www.milb.com/news/breakout-candidate-toronto-blue-jays-adam-kloffenstein. Accessed 20 January 2022. “2022 Top 100 Prospects.” Baseball America , 19 January 2022, https://www.baseballamerica.com/rankings/2022-top-100-prospects/. Accessed 20 January 2022. 5
